body.name: Grimgar of Fantasy and Ash (Light Novel) Vol. 8
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Bookbag Buddy and Fulfilled by Amazon.
editorialReviews: Editorial Reviews About the Author Ao Jyumonji is a Japanese author best known for the Grimgar of Fantasy and Ash light novels. Eiri Shirai is a Japanese manga artist best known for theillustrations in Grimgar of Fantasy and Ash.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Thursday, February 22 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 13 hrs 33 mins

body.description: DON’T SPLIT THE PARTY! Haruhiro and his team have fought their way back to Grimgar–only to emerge in a harsh and desolate region, beset by orcs and undead! When a series of misfortunes separates them from each other, the individual members do what they must to survive, including teaming up with the factions they find. What they don’t expect, however, is to end up facing each other as enemies! When friend becomes foe, how does one win?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great character development
reviews.reviewText: This is the first time on all volumes I feel such deep and rich character development. They each have a unique personality and/or story. It is also the first time I see Haruhiro really grow significantly. I hope it would be more though. It still feels the mc is developing too slowly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Keeps me glued
reviews.reviewText: Definitely slept on by a lot of people, awesome series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars I did enjoy the book
reviews.reviewText: As a long time fan of the series, I did enjoy the book. The writing was of similar quality as previous entries and the characters are still quite enjoyable. If anything I think there was a greater attention to detail paid to the characters of our main group. Some unorthodox pairings were put forward here and they had an interesting back and forth between them. The only issue I really have with this entry, and it's really more of a personal preference than anything at this point, is that the book didn't seem finished. The climax at the end of the story felt more like it was a half way point in a larger volume.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This book sucked me in and I couldn't put it down until ...
reviews.reviewText: This book sucked me in and I couldn't put it down until I finished it. It expands well on the universe even though its just a small pocket. All characters got their own time and the MC is developing well. Can't wait for volume 9.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Another great entry in the series
reviews.reviewText: Exciting and great to see the relationships between the party become more complicated and develop, as well as how they've become much more skilled and respectable as the series developed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Something new something good: ) I enjoyed where the turn of events ...
reviews.reviewText: Something new something good :) I enjoyed where the turn of events took me, some unexpected things happened I like to be suppressed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2018
reviews.reviewText: This series still has me drawn in after 8 volumes, and I'm ready for more. I hope to see many more installments.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Why so short?
reviews.reviewText: It felt really short, probably because the story is broken up between perspectives, but not worth waiting so long for (although this doesn't make me love the story any less). Also the cliffhanger killed me! GRRAAAH!! Now I have to wait forever for the next one....All in all wasn't bad, and I enjoyed having the rest of the group fleshed out more and getting to see their perspective/thoughts on things.
Sigo sintiendo la historia fresca, así como el arco anterior. Sin duda alguna recomiendo continúen con la lectura de la novela.

Começa num ritmo lento e vai melhorando.Não há muito desenvolvimento dos personagens, mas o grupo conhece novos personagens bastante interessantes.Os pontos negativos são os problemas de autoestima de Haruhiro (tá irritante já) e o "cliffhanger" no final do livro. Bem, o próximo volume já está disponível, então menos mal.
A solid addition to the Grimgar story. The introduction of some great villains really made this chapter. With a great lead into the next chapter!

He through the 7 was great but this one is even better, the begining is a little slow but when the story goes on it's great. I like the fact that this volume give more insigth on the relationship between the other partie member, i also love the evolution of haruhiro but in fact all the partie member are devloped and for one of them it's realy unspected, the monster also get a lot of time and personality. Overall the serie continue to get better as volumes go on.
